C0EeyQC8Ihno74iyBwM3tg.text: Just attended a private event at this establishment.  Therefore, I can't attest to the cost of entry, but will talk about the quality, service, food, and drinks.  I am a big fan of the reclining seats.  These were different than what I have experienced in the past.  There were two seats together with about 6 inches between the next set of seats together.  This is a great place to either put one's purse or just not be on top of a stranger sitting next to you.    The menu is limited for a restaurant, but more extensive than a normal theater.  We shared the carnivore flatbread.  Tasty, but small.  The popcorn was average movie popcorn.  The pretzel bits had two dipping sauces, but only the cheese was in good.  The mustard sauce was eh.  Also, the sodas were in tall plastic glass with no covers.  Great for adults, but I wonder about little ones.  We received refills.  So, thumbs up to that!  We would like to return to enjoy another movie here and tap the alcohol drinks offered.

Ln8ciomneaman0uoqH_y_w.text: Love watching movies here!!    Reclining seat and food is pretty good.    Drinks are awesome and there are some amazing service.  We have had subpar service as well.   It won't stop me from watching the movies in comfortable seats  Get the Groupon or come on Tuesday for special prices.   Popcorn is legit good.  Chicken strips are yummy, burger has been okay, sliders are great but they took them off the menu!  Hopefully they get them back!   Overall highly recommend this place for a nice movie day or night time!

bSgKIn7iIZqM3JaRoDs12Q.text: This was the most amazing experience and had the most comfortable chairs everrrrr. The service was prompt and quick. You basically enter the theater, look at their menu and press a button and a server comes through with your orders. The drinks were delicious and prepared well. The food was astounding. I would definitely come back here again. This by far exceeded my expectations.

7fMwI1zVm2RcdGs_BODWDw.text: I finally made it to my 500th review & for my 500th its all about the Eclipse Theater.  The reason, we celebrated our pre-anniversary here, a very special celebration. Our 22nd Anniversary, in luxury style at the Eclipse theater. We even toasted to our 22nd with champagne.    Eclipse is a very upscale theater with 8 auditoriums, with theater food and beverage service. As you enter, the box office is on the first floor, you will have the option to purchase your tickets on line, at the box office, or the 2 kiosk near the entrance. You will also get to select your seats. The theater, bar, & bathroom is located on the 2nd level. Once you get to your seat & get comfortable, get ready to push that button for service.   My husband and I really enjoyed our first time experience here with champagne, food, & theater food and beverage service. I love the food and beverage service concept. We now have the luxury reclining seats in Hawaii but without the wait service. I noticed the screens are huge, seats are bigger and there is more leg room. The food tray & drink holder are just perfect. I was having such a great time, I was so comfortable, I didn't want the movie to end.    If you are early for your movie, I love the idea that you can hang out in the bar or patio area. We made it just in time for our movie. I recommend coming in a few minutes before the movie, so you can look at the menu and find your seats. I had a hard time, to decide on what to order since it was dark. Our waitress was super friendly & quick, I placed my order of popcorn with extra butter, sweet potato tots, chicken wings (with request for ranch sauce on the side) & champagne. I do miss the Mochi crunch with my popcorn. The popcorn was buttery & fresh with just right amount of salt. The tots & chicken were very tasty for theater food. I've never had sweet potato tots before.   Overall, we had an amazing time here, enjoying our movie and celebrating our 22nd, I recommend the Eclipse theater. Happy 500th & cheers to 22nd @ The Eclipse Theater, Las Vegas. We will be back!!

XxQsOILR1UVHCfbBY7B9_g.text: The actual tickets are a little on the high-end.  However, that's for a theater with about 25 seats that recline.  You get what you pay for.  The lounge has a very chill vibe with friendly staff.  The food is excellent as are the drinks.  Definitely a place to go for that movie you REALLY are looking forward to seeing

LZ0inBq7Ov7EHH1XVhptmg.text: Love love love this place!  First off, I've been raving about how other cities have movie style restaurants and how that would be just a great idea. One day I stumbled upon Eclipse on yelp! and I couldn't believe it. I told all my friends!  But finally had the time to watch a movie. We saw MazeRunner (love love that movie Dylan O'Brien... drool). Located downtown area. There's parking outside and also behind there's a parking garage near an alleyway. It's not hard to find, it's well lit. And it's free parking.   Side note, there's a Groupon floating around for this place. Check it out. Also there's a bar inside.  Seating is great. Very roomy just like luxury theaters. You push the silver button and a server will come. We got 2 pitchers of sangria (I expected a big pitcher but it was kinda small), lobster roll, wagu sliders, bruschetta, and pretzel bites. All amazing! it was literally like gourmet foods. It was unexpectedly sooooo  delicious. But it is tapas style so just prepare to order more foods. A bit on the pricey side for small bites BUT worth it, In my opinion.   After watching a movie this way, you will never want to watch a movie regularly. Only thing is you will easily spend over $100 if you go here. It sends standards high for movie dates now. A girl goes here on a date she'll expect all movies to be like this!   Can't wait to come back!

7dVQxSUKv38_Vh1QrXJhLQ.text: My daughter and I just caught the matinee for The Lion King here. Parking was a snap. You enter the area via the alley to the ear of the building. As soon as we entered the building, my daughter spoke of how much she liked the feel of the space. We picked the tickets from the front desk, had our tickets accepted and were seated, all by a very welcoming staff. We ordered food and had it delivered to us in much the same fashion.  The seats were comfortable and the seating arrangement made the food delivery and dining experience very intimate and discreet. The food was better than average, but I'd stop short of labeling it high-end. Based on the appearance and taste our nachos and fish-n-chips, the theater has achieved that delicate balance of cost-to-value, as it relates to ticket prices.  The decor and lighting were conducive to relaxation, as was the theater temperature. Screen size, positioning, projection and sound quality all played well to an intimate and upscale experience.  It was quiet and those also in attendance were respectful of the space. While costly for a group on one tab, Eclipse provides an exceptional resource for dates and special occasions for couples and smaller groups. I'd like to go back when opportunity presents itself.

m3uddiYYLn2o2cnzelKZcg.text: To me it feels like a bad sign when I go somewhere and the owner or manager is walking around greeting patrons and trying to talk to them. At least they're trying..  The lobby feels like most the government buildings downtown. Cold and empty. Upstairs, didn't look great. It looks like the other old buildings downtown with re-done walls, but this is a new(ish) building I thought?   Yes the seats recline, but felt cheap. Those seats won't last very long there. We saw Endgame, which should look awesome, but picture was meh.. I figured picture would be sharp and impressive if we were paying that much. Same with the Sound. I guess you could call it passable, I couldn't understand dialog at times. More than that, you could hear the bass from the screen next door throughout most of the movie. Quiet emotional parts of the movie had very noticeable rumbling bass going on!   We pressed the service button well before previews ever started. It took over half hour for a server.. We ordered popcorn. They brought our change an hour later but still no popcorn. They had forgotten our order! Eventually we did get the popcorn, and it was good, and it was fresh. Good thing it was a 3 hour movie. I get that they were busy, but that was not a good experience. They could also be more discreet about delivering food through the movie.. it was distracting every time a server walked in front with trays and lights.  Overall, it was ok. But it just feels like they are cutting a lot of corners. Will be going somewhere else next time.

3-LyJ8_pjJvUig0PKDOI2w.text: With $18 tickets and at least a 30% markup on all the food, Eclipse Theaters is definitely a splurge. That said, I think it shines for matinee movies, when you want to pay more for more space and fewer enthusiastic children (if you're of the "let me watch my movie in peace" persuasion).  I tried the flatbread (very tasty) and the apple cobbler, served in a cast iron pan with ice cream (fantastically tasty).  I'm knocking off a point due to the location, which isn't terribly convenient, and the sparseness of the lobby and hallways which made it feel incomplete. But if you have the money to spend on movies, go for it.

HwL_WK5JeQ1nPR6H_0BASQ.text: Excellent movie theater.  The seats recline and very comfortable.  The food was hit-and-miss.   Yes I said the food because this place is a combination of a restaurant, bar, and movie theater.  So expect to pay more then usual.   The bar was very good although the bar tender did not seem to be aware of what was happy hour and what was not.    However drinks excelled my expectations.  Would give it a 4 star rating just because of the overpriced drinks.    The movie theater gets a 5.   As I said, great seats.   The restaurant gets 3 stars.   The food looked great but was missing flavor or anything unique.   The pizza was undercooked and had to send it back.   Overall, the food was good but overpriced for restaurant.   So overall give the business a 4.    Next time will get a drink and enjoy the movie.  May skip on the meal.  Stick to popcorn.

cpQNbZj6ngPmRSF9HO--Kg.text: We were on vacation and needed something to do on a rainy day that was far away from the Strip.  The prices are extremely fair on Tuesdays and comparable to luxury seat prices elsewhere.  The seats are very comfortable and we thoroughly enjoyed the recliners.  The layout of the theater is shockingly sparse on seating which provides for an entirely different (positive) movie going experience.  (PS...the middle arm rest folds up for couples wanting to not be separated)  The food options were perfectly fine for us.  Initially they seemed expensive but then I remembered how much we get gauged for a bag of popcorn elsewhere and realized $18 for a lobster grilled cheese sandwich and bisque dipping sauce is rather fair in comparison.  And the buffalo fried cauliflower is amazing.  I really enjoyed the Mars v Venus cocktail and sharing a carafe of sangria.  It was a fun option for vacation without the traditional Vegas over-the-top debauchery so common on the Strip.  The server was prompt with delivery and and friendly.  We actually even had fun chatting with the ticket taker before and after watching the movie.  We definitely recommend the theater and will make it a regular stop for our trips to Vegas that we do every few years.

oY5tZFTMXsuUg7LkGEQwJg.text: I'm not sure why people rate this place so high. It looks like a hospital for one.  Two, the sound is horrible. Audio engineering husband can confirm. Three, they don't clean their projectors so you can hear the fan the ENTIRE movie. I've seen 2 movies here and this is not high quality as they want it to be. We went to see "A Quiet Place"...and it was loud AF because of the projectors. Hahahahahahaha. It's actually really funny, honestly.  Four, the caulking in the bathrooms are even a joke. It looks like they hired a classroom of kindergartners to do it for them for free. Child labor. And I'm not knocking 5yr old kids. They just haven't hit their caulking peak yet.  Seriously, they threw this theater together in such little time to rush to open and didn't actually want to put the time and effort into making this a True luxury theater. Can confirm, talked to the people that built it. Silliness. For the price you pay for most theaters in town, it's more worth it to go to one closer to your home. Most theaters now have online seating reservations available and leather recliners. Everyone is up to date with the cool shiz. And yes, way better sound and the projectors don't interrupt your movie.  The only benefit is the button to call for more beer. But the food is "meh".   Don't waste your time.

HYSIZ3RpTTgiV0KWFxzQQg.text: This Theater is so beautiful and luxurious! The seats are big and comfy! People are very friendly and helpful! The only down fall was the food prices are very pricey. Next time, I'll have dinner before going to the movies!!

iTxgHN9AziquzGhdjHCpdg.text: Overpriced food ,dirty and old scratches drinking reusable drinking glasses ,also  Management seen sleeping on guest area worst experience in a movie theater ever ,save your money go somewhere else this place is a Joke

bw4UhLgGVDrh2iQ5Jw2jqA.text: What am I missing? Interior seemed rough and pop corn was way too salty and buttery and ice cream seemed like it came from the local grocery store. I expected the moon but I've seen far better and for a 18 dollar ticket beside limited seating I expect a lot more.

PZJtbPO-mjj02K-7WV0pJg.text: Really nice place to watch a movie. The theater is huge but there weren't very many seats. The seats were oversized leather recliners. The sound was great. I have found that in some theaters the sound isn't as good as it should be but this place had it dialed in.   The food was fairly priced based on what you would expect from a movie theater. We got sodas and they came in really small glasses like you would get at a bar and they weren't cheap. We got popcorn and it came in a bag, basically what would have been a medium in another theater. It was coated in butter, which I did not like. It was really greasy. I find these types of places really annoying. I don't like ordering this way and it took them 10 minutes to respond after we pressed the button so we didn't have our food until the movie already started.   I would have given 5 stars but the heater was not on. It was literally 50 degrees inside the theater. I complained to the server and he just agreed that it was cold. It was awful, really took away from the experience. No one offered us a refund or even tried to explain why it was so cold. We were miserable. I will more than likely go back and I would recommend it to others but make sure the heater is working.

yCMuklyfeZM7cWwc8813rA.text: Upscale!  Eclipse Theatre had plenty tickets and convenient showtimes for Thor this evening which lured my favorite unfiltered dame and I in to watch Chris "eye candy" Hemsworth kick some butt on the big screen!  The theater is upscale and completely surpassed my expectations and then some. The recliner seats are comfy and the theater itself is "five second rule" worthy (very clean)!  The pricing is a bit higher than I anticipated but the top notch in theater dining takes date night to a whole new level. If your feeling fancy splurge a little at check this place out; I don't think you'll be disappointed!  Cocktail Shrimp $8.00 Voss 1 Liter Bottle $7  Popcorn $7.00  $23+ Not your "typical" concession   I'm certain I'd return in the near future

photos.caption: Photo of Eclipse Theaters - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Eclipse Theaters - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1HTDJrf-aJ7C29TTauoagQ.text: Came here during Fifty Shades Freed opening weekend in hopes of a nice date night. This theater was equal parts garbage to the movie itself. Boyfriend orders one large popcorn for us within five minutes of being seated via the armrest button which summons a server. Gives said server a $10 bill. Over 30 minutes roll by without any sign of food being served anywhere. Pushed the button again, asked a different server when we could expect our popcorn and were curtly told "We haven't started serving food yet." Oh really? Maybe the popcorn is made-to-order in this theater, which would be the only reason I could possibly think of as to why our popcorn was grouped in the same category as chicken fingers and burgers and was to be served alongside them. Ridiculous. Wait ANOTHER 30 minutes before noticing that everyone- including the couple next to us with three popcorns- had received their food and we had not. One popcorn, people. Pushed the damn button again and tell the server we've been waiting over AN HOUR for popcorn that hasn't come, please give us our money back. "Okay," she says, without a care or concern in the world. No apology given. Another 15 minutes rolls by while we watch this same server walking up and down the aisles distributing bills and wrapping up orders. What the actual ****. Call her AGAIN, ask where the hell our refund is. "Oh, she didn't bring it yet?" I say, "who is 'she'???? I asked YOU!" Wait another 15 minutes for our $10 bill to come back to us. No popcorn, no apology, pure B.S. Cool concept, failed execution and poor customer service. Many other luxury theaters around the valley are executing this very same business model with style and grace. Yours sucks.

2BwTPELufhlsBwpA3ZB0iw.text: I love this place. Its kind of in a secluded area but it was a nice experience and very clean. All the staff were great! I highly recommend this place!

IQ2Mb-Nv-L0fkP31o6BqUg.text: This was the best movie theater I have ever been to. The theater was clean and the staff was really friendly. I loved the electric reclining seats and drink/meal service right to your chair. They even offer blankets if you get cold. The theater is located near downtown and all seats were excellent to view the screen. I wish they would bring this same style to Bay Area in CA. Definitely recommend hands down thumbs up.

photos.caption: Photo of Eclipse Theaters - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Reclining seats and tray tables with drink holders

gApGDFo-QkMCSW2XHbC8Uw.text: My hubby and I went to see Black Panther here last night. We wanted to see this movie at a black owned theatre for the culture, but was left unfortunately underwhelmed. First of all, the parking is not ideal. Very limited spaces forcing us to park on the street in a somewhat sketchy neighborhood. $18 per seat, not including any drinks or food. Movie was suppose to start at 10:30, didn't until at least 10:50 because theatre was not cleaned in time. Seriously poor planning on their part.  Drinks are small and expensive. Plan on paying about $15 for 3-4 sips. We ordered the Caribbean jerk chicken wings that had absolutely NO FLAVOR! The hamburger sliders were better. On the positive side, our waitress Alexandria was very sweet and attentive and the seats were comfortable.  So, we spent about $140 to see one movie and had to deal with an obnoxious group next to us who wouldn't STFU! We'll stick to our local theatre Santa Fe Station.

5CrT5ScfbXKsWOMGZ7o1pw.text: Food's good.  Theater's nice.  I like it.  But the waiter drops the check and starts talking to us right in the emotional climax of infinity war.  Dude, can't you wait a few minutes?  Kinda ruined the movie.  If I go back I'll specifically ask them to wait until the credits or just bring the check in advance or something.

Tz_5DFuv3J2KthSKPi21ZQ.text: Absolutely the venue however the bar staff are rude unfriendly and seem mad, very unprofessional, and I'm uncomfortable in the lounge...for that alone, I'd prefer another movie theater from here on out. The male hosts were extremely professional and friendly, and I wish the lounge was more comfortable. This business won't survive like this!

pD4fLMI853PYkXd9SVZkaw.text: I like the idea behind this theatre but I just keep having blah experiences. I live a block away and was excited when this place opened but it's always so inconsistent. One week I have the chicken lollipops. The next week they are off the menu. One visit I get a spiked milkshake for $15... the next they charge me something like $22 for the same exact shake. Another time the waitress does last call as soon as our movie starts. No wonder why the place is always empty. We probably spend over $100 any time we visit. It's just not worth it in my opinion. The seats are comfy and I do feel bad for the waitstaff but I'll be eating at home before I go see another movie here.

s_oBeQR_LlVLjzsm6H0VXQ.text: First time here at eclipse, with friends.  There's parking in the back but not a lot. So you'll have to drive up and down the side streets to find a park.  Luckily there's no charge for parking. The great thing about this place is that you can purchase tickets online or with the concierge.   Pros: It's a nice place to go for a date.  It's upscale. You can order food, drinks at the bar, or inside the theater. There's a nice patio outside to overlook the neighborhood. The food looked pretty good from what I saw.  Cons: The bar service is terrible! My friends and I waited 20 mins for our drinks.  The bartender took our order and  kept taking orders from everyone else. Another bartender didn't even ask others or acknowledge others at the bar. The one that took our order left put in other orders went to help at a party. It wasn't until we got up and left the bar that he said he would start making our drinks! Another bar patron went off on him for waiting also!   My thing is if you're going to have a party on a Saturday night, which is the busiest nights of the weekend! Management should've had a host for the party and at least three bartenders. It takes a lot for me not to return to a business. Every business has an off day and I think this was your off day. Please regroup, strategize, for events and busy nights. They did give us a free pretzel bites, but this experience left me with a bad taste.

N0pSUkuIvuca_qogsz90gQ.text: Great experience. Staff is friendly and helpful. Food is not too expensive compared to commercial theatres

gS86K1l3_qyHB2y0pY1kNw.text: Girl friend bought a Groupon that covers 2 entries, medium popcorn and a drink. Get there to watch Black Panther and it turns out that groupons won't be allowed to be used until March 1st, apparently groupons are not allowed to be used for any new releases. We double checked the terms and conditions on the Groupon and this term isn't in there at all. Luckily Groupon will refund this but maybe eclipse should include this clause so that they don't waste our time and gas. I guess Regal is getting our money today.

8B9OwwzUg3tch0l7Zf3SIw.text: Best place for a date night! No need to go out to eat before . The food is amazing and the setting is perfect for a romantic date night or a group of friends! I've done both and had a wonderful experience both times. Staff is friendly and timely . Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Eclipse Theaters - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A special dessert served during the movie IT! Mmmmm delicious !

lfb-yJQRBayVavUmwseGgw.text: Very clean place...upscale....bar and dining area...staff are very nice... chef even spent time talking with us about the food, which is delicious! Seats are very comfortable. Worth it all.

HY7w9GOpz5rbdFzrAnssQw.text: Love the theater and some of the menu items. The steak I ordered was flavorless and tough but the chicken wings were great! I wanted to have a birthday party for my children but I never received an email from the rep. This is a great place for date night.

m4z4bSYR12B_eqUhb7DZiQ.text: Amazing! It's a little pricey but if you are taking someone out special it's a must! Seats go way back and no center divider! Very clean and the staff is great!

t3Kw9qt9dF4xq3N3VnH2-Q.text: First timer and the concierge showed us all the amenities very graciously. The space is gorgeous,spotless and easy to access. The theaters are unique because you have your own waitstaff that deliver cocktails,meals and blankets for rather small prices. $20 endless mimosas till 2. Score! They had a brunch going on and a brunch special during our movie. Reclining chairs and ample street parking with an attached garage. No roaming through casinos that don't give back to the community. I'm hooked. Perfect location and I hope they will build more around lv.

photos.caption: Photo of Eclipse Theaters - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The dining and bar area even has a patio.

7xntSfmRWig7wZPx2opT3w.text: Nice enough theatre but won't last at these prices. Came on a Friday night for last showing and it was completely dead. No one else in our theatre and two people at the bar.   Appreciate wanting to class up downtown, but you're going to have to drop your prices if you plan to compete with Galaxy. Or at minimum, start having cheap nights with specials.   Would like to keep patronizing the theatre but it's not economical for most people.

gP-6LDHmlYcNHgPadq83qQ.text: One word to describe my experience at the so-called "luxurious," Eclipse Theatre: DISAPPOINTMENT.   We ordered a popcorn and two drinks. Not only did the server take 30+ minutes to deliver our order, but he forgot our drinks. I pressed the button to remind them and placed an order for one order of rib sliders and one order of lobster rolls (I was on a date so don't think I'm as fat as I sound hahah). Anyways, when I placed this order, we mentioned the missing drinks. The [new] server apologized and took our drink orders. This time, we were served the wrong items YET AGAIN. We were given a Diet Coke instead of a regular. And, we were given pulled pork sliders instead of rib sliders. You'd think it'd stop there. It didn't. Meanwhile, a friend who happened to be sitting next to us (small world) also placed a food order. Instead, they took her card and forgot a step--bringing her the damn food she ordered. And, that's not all folks. My girlfriend went to the restroom prior to the movie and there was no toilet paper. 2 hours and 20 minutes later, after Wonder Woman ended, I had gone to the restroom. Not one stall had toilet paper. You'd think that after nearly 2.5 hours they'd at least replace the toilet paper in this "luxury" theatre. Well, jokes on us. We had spent nearly $100 to be duped into one of the worst theatre experiences I've ever endured. Thanks Eclipse.

9B6et4lw159OrGsGgBSI5Q.text: Black owned... luxurious... need I say more. Been there twice and have had a wonderful time.

gqw7An5ClxHV8azOpSS4QA.text: Great place ! Just go ahead and buy your tickets . Groupon currently has a deal including drinks and popcorn .

photos.caption: Photo of Eclipse Theaters - Las Vegas, NV, United States

d7y_jtABnqFrRlyHAWjhNQ.text: This place was awesome! Very hipster and upscale without being out of financial reach of middle class people. The parking is safe and the garage is easy to get to (especially if you're early enough). My husband and I loved it! Comfy, enjoyable, lots of other things to offer for nightlife. Plus, they have Groupon offers almost always.

nyL6-ZILx2clV7g7ABPrYQ.text: This is definitely my new favorite movie theater in Las Vegas. The building has a trendy feeling too it and kind of reminds me of a revamped library. It's located downtown which is an up and coming area of the city. There's plenty of free street parking around and we had no problems finding the place. Once you enter, you purchase your tickets downstairs and then head upstairs for the theaters and lounge area. They also have a comedy club located on the third floor, but we did not check that out yet.   We found a sweet Groupon deal for tickets, popcorn and two sodas for around $30. All of the staff members were super friendly & gave more of a personal touch then the standard rude corporate theaters. The theater had the nice reclining type chairs and I like that the staff delivers everything right to your seat. They have a full bar and feature some fun themed drinks for big movie releases.  Besides the normal popcorn they have a pretty diverse menu. During our recent visit we shared some onion rings and chicken tenders. Both were very good, better then some restaurant's quality.   I will certainly be back again and again. This place is truly a gem.

Nzw3NBXkVgVB8NBmaDNRgg.text: Such horrible people working here  Ordered over priced drinks never received  They actually shut off the air conditioning on 107 degree night 2 hrs before movie was over  Manager had nasty attitude about me asking for my drink to be fixed that they messed up  we rented out whole theater and u think they would be happy to have business

p2z20J7KORlhA7zm4bM2fQ.text: Cool little theater in Vegas off the beaten path.  It is full service with a great food menu and drinks.  Groupon deal with Champaign bottle is the best deal.   When done with the movie they have a nice little lounge with small balcony.  The night I was there they had a live band too.    Overall, a decent modern movie theater

B4V3p-Q2QFiLJC2vdcRCLw.text: We liked it! The theatres are small and intimate. They have this little slide arm table that fits over your lap and you can place your drink and food on there.   I, of course, had a Groupon so I had two popcorns and four drinks (uck, Pepsi products), as well as four tickets. Easy to use.   We scored and were the only ones in the theatre so we had extra privacy! Service was rather slow (I mean, we were the ONLY ones in the theatre).   They have very easy and ample parking right behind the theatre and it was a nice, COOL place to escape the insane heat.   If we were locals, we would be regulars. NO KIDS AFTER 6:00pm.

vOZBH7guSVAK9QShe-gtEQ.text: Mood- movie   Upon entering tried the kiosk as there was a bit of a wait, I guess it just didn't like me. Lol, so went and stood in line. After purchase took the elevator to the 2nd floor where all the fun is.   There is a decent bar, with a nice lounge area. Plenty of seating with windows to look out and just take in the vibe of downtown. I got a mint mojito which was made nicely.   The theater itself was not large but every seat was definitely a good one. Yes reclining seats, and table service by the push of a button.   Opted for nachos and fries. Both were brought in a fairly quick timeline. Pricing is what to be expected for this type of experience, that is pushed as luxury. It isn't cheap to say the least, but it is nice to entertain something different.  Would recommend   Location is 3rd/ Gass - parking is their garage for free or streets.

hYtQINOxpoDk1tWKx3R5Zw.text: Perfect place to go on a movie date, and an actual high end type of movie date. This isn't a regular AMCor Regal experience, this is ECLIPSE! Eclipse is located downtown off 3rd and Charleston. Very upscale vibe to this theater, so if you're looking to impress someone, here is the perfect place! Not only can you come watch movies but you can come just to enjoy the food and bar, or even on Tuesday's they have a comedy show. Big thank you to Mikal for showing me around the building and what everything Eclipse has to offer. The one thing that stuck out to me the most is that not only is it a luxury theater, but you won't have to leave your seat unless you need to use the restroom! Everything is accessible with the touch of a button and a server comes to take your order of food and/or beverage. With big screenings or movie releases like Avengers Endgame, this is the perfect experience!   I watched the Michael Jordan documentary and they had the whole floor on lock for special guests and invites just for the premiere. You can rent out a floor for a party, movie screening, shows, etc!    Parking is great because they have their own parking structure, spaces in front of the venue, and after 5:30PM, the law firm across the street allows overflow parking.

photos.caption: Photo of Eclipse Theaters - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Phn1peR9OeNyUTFvZI5LKA.text: Well, this was the spot husband picked for date night. It's a good concept dinner and a movie, had something similar in Portland OR. I'm not quite sure how this place stays in business. In the theater we were in there were only 4 people. It was pretty empty throughout. They do have a bar lounge area so I guess it could be a gathering place.  The theater itself, well the sound system could be better. It was not on the level of Galaxy or any other luxury theater. The menu was very limited in food choices and I would classify it as "bar" food. It wasn't the best I've had, we both had the flatbreads, but it also wasn't the worst.  It was a fair experience but safe to say we probably will not be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Eclipse Theaters - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside theater 1

TTbMGv08wpn3MdlSBlKxfA.text: This is the best theater in town! Reclining, comfortable seating. Great sound and picture. There's small limited seating available so it makes for a more intimaten personal, and unique experience. Kid are also not allowed after 6 p.m.!   Heard they had some bankruptcy issue going on, but I was told by an employer that they aren't going to be closing any time soon. Good news!  The bar and lounge area is beautiful and has the option to sit outside to enjoy the Spring weather.   The -1 star is for their food. I've been coming here for quite some time and have not been impressed with the food. Most recently, I came here and ordered the chicken wings and fries. The fries were similar to the type of fry you get a McDonald's.  The wings were rubbed with their "signature" sauce, but it was only red hot. Nothing special. I would not complain about this if it wasn't for the high prices for serving mediocre food.   Regardless, this is the best movie experience in town and I'll keep supporting this local gem in Downtown Vegas

_uZNSk39-opVnfjPvPDynQ.text: Friendly staff Theaters are clean Nice menu Only thing is when you're at the bar it takes a while til somebody takes notice of you and other staffers walking by just look at you and keep it moving not even a greet or an attempt to get someone to take an order.

photos.caption: Photo of Eclipse Theaters - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Movie,drink, and legs. Great combination

PXTD6m3xMGkMxrWZvIQeJw.text: Uh ummm... *clearing my throat*. The concept of a lounge theater is great. But let me dissect this establishment for a minute.   Entrance: there was no signage at movie ticket counter that was immediately visible upon entrance. My hubs and I stood there looking for the movies and showtimes, as one does when they go to the movies... but ummm... no. We had to stand there and interact with the concierge as she verbally stated what movies were there. We knew what we wanted to see before patronizing the establishment; but still. That wasn't my favorite.   Ambiance: ambience was nice, the 'exclusive lounge feel' was in full effect/ cheesy in some respects, but I got the concept. The big leather reclining lounge chairs were nice, the service was perfect, and the theater was generally clean. Two thumbs up for that.   Annoyances: although the theater provides food service throughout the entire movie- it was a bit irritating that servers walk around, take orders, whisper to folks, and trot up and down while the movie is happening. Because of someone's order discrepancy, things got a tiny rambunctious during the movie, causing me to miss a couple of crucial changes in the movie. Also, the stairs floor lights were lit the entire movie for the servers (which I understand) but it was totally On. My. Nerves.   Overall: the movie itself was great, service was good, but there could be an improvement or two.   Would I go back. Most likely- when in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Eclipse Theaters - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside....
Photo of Eclipse Theaters - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XfzgFou0dY1J87hP7oKNrQ.text: I like this theater, great seats, great munchies, and a full bar but it's starting to deteriorate.   Management needs to keep up with maintenance. It's the little things, a missing tile in the corner, a stained seat at the bar, no bloody Mary mix on Sunday morning. Ha ha ha, I was craving a michelada, and the bartender said "sorry I have no tomato or any red juices".   I'll keep coming back but time will tell.

424LDg8F_Wv-mJhVem1-_A.text: Update: I have now been here several times for several movies, and even their Sunday brunch. I have to say that the brunch is fabulous. Bottomless mimosas's or bloody Mary's, that you can take into the bar when you are done with your movie. Does it get any better than that? The seasonal rotating menu is legit and always keeps it exciting. I've tried many other craft cocktails at the bar and I am very impressed. I would come here just to be a patron of the bar. They infuse their liquors in house, to make some really creative drinks. Jay is a great bartender who makes an amazing old fashioned. If you can make an old fashioned that impresses me, you've got my business for life.

Rn32y-7W0-AXW1P8nfhfnA.text: I saw a movie here last night and the service was A++ everyone was friendly and greeted us walking in and spoke to us on the way out. Customer service is big to me and they got it right.   My only Con: parking was kind of hard to find.  Now the food: I ordered the shrimp & fries and both were good the shrimp was crispy and good. They gave a pretty good amount of food! My friend ordered the Parmesan wings and she loved them.  Drinks: I ordered a margarita and it was good it wasn't too strong but I can taste the tequila.   It's a really nice place the seats are comfy and recline which I love. I definitely will be back.

hIv7indOAkIPUlEnDBGU1g.text: Fun date night.   Employees here are super friendly, but there is a lot of random stuff I do not like about this place.   I wish they had a traditional walk up snack bar. (I know you can ring your button bell from your seat.)  Bring your checkbook! Tickets are $18 bucks and if you order drinks and food you can easily spend a couple of Benjamin's here. Oh well, it's worth it.

U5WoCwnXzHPeOYkstFqhsQ.text: #52 for 2018  To be able to sit down in your comfy reclining seat, and then you place an order, was something I had to experience.  It's a gimmick but a nice feature to have.  Because alcohol is served, children under the age of 21 is not permitted to shows after 6pm.  The ticket booth is to your left as you enter.  Gentlemen was very friendly.  He  asked if we'd been here before.  Because it was our 1st visit, he explained how the operation was set up. $16 for adult tickets, $12 for children 16 and under.  On Tuesdays, all tickets are $12.  Nice.  We took the staircase up to the 2nd floor met by another gentleman who processed our tickets allowing us to proceed in.  A nice lounge bar, cordoned off, to the left with big windows gave a some what nice view of the city.  You could see some planes going in and out of the airport.  Fascinating.  We found our seats easily.  No rush needed because it is reserved seating.  Menus were there.  The room is not very big.  They were clean.  No stickiness on the table thank goodness.  In the center of the table is the call button you depress once you decide what you would like to order.  We just ate but decided to get the nachos, turkey sliders and a drink.  $31.60 for all that.  Not cheap at all.  Well for the experience.  The girl taking our order was nice, as in nice to look at but cold as stone.  Everything else was by the book and the order came out right after she came back to tell me they were out of the smoked bbq  chicken  sliders.  It was the 1st show of the day.  Hence, why I opted  for turkey.  We enjoyed the movie.  We do know how to pick 'em.  Loved the reclining seats.  These are now the standard,  If the theaters can come down in the price it would be nice.  I wasn't impressed with the food.  At those dollar prices there should be a wow factor.  Meat on the nachos would be a good start.  I didn't even know there were jalapenos until the the chips and cheese were gone.  Could you please put them last, on top.  The $14 turkey sliders was not that good either.  Using a previous frozen turkey paddy does not make the price. Neither does the sweet bbq sauce to give some taste hiding everything else about it.  The drink is unlimited.  Cold ginger ale we shared with lots of ice was so good to have in this over the top 100 This is a degree heat wave that has taken over the town.  This is a nice theater to come to.  It's not crowded.  Feels subdued, relax and chill.  Might be good to come into the bar in the later evening to see the city lights.  It's clean. Quiet.  I would  come back but I would not want to order off the mneu.

U9xqtDl6jkFOAZTetnYzyw.text: I don't usually Yelp but had to regarding this theatre. This theatre is completely underrated! We just left after watching the movie Ready or Not. This place was very VIP! I will definitely be back. The parking garage was great with a private entrance. The food was delicious and the service was fantastic. If you want a 5 star experience I recommend this hidden gem!!

8UJtli-Qp7IBfhnegS2MGg.text: Great theatre, great food, and drinks!  My only complaint is if you use the Groupon make sure to call and find out if you can see the movie you want.  "Tickets may not be redeemed for certain films".  That's in the fine print. The place itself is very nice and elegant.  The ticking area is downstairs and you can take an elevator or stairs to get to the 2nd floor and the bar is located just of to the left once you get upstairs.  I had the sangria, and some popcorn when I got in the actual theatre.   The host knew her role very well.  She memorized what she had to say and made getting in simple.  The seats are comfortable and the sound was excellent.  I saw only maybe 25 seats in the part we were in so its not super crowded with a bunch of people.

E8w8-nC_OWCXSqToCq8XSg.text: Pros: small theaters, great consistent food,  Loyalty program, perfect atmosphere.   If you're looking for an intimate experience where it feels like home the eclipse is the perfect spot.  I'm always surprised more people don't know about the place.   I'm one of those people who like to enjoy a movie in peace and quiet. People seem to get it and I've never had any issues with other movie goers ruining the experience.   The food is ah-maze-zing. If you're like me and you like consistency you'll appreciate the quality.   Try the onion rings they're bomb!   Cons:   Drinks are over priced but they are delicious so maybe with it.   The life is beautiful drink is great.  Service at the bar was meh, but maybe it was just one of those days.   I've always had great service in the theater.   Overall: it's a must go! Its the only way I'll go to the movies. I'll pay for the atmosphere alone, totally worth it!

zbbCEzesmAMyAGid1L_HIw.text: Grossly overpriced! $18 per ticket for a movie before 3pm! And they said it was because they have ppl bring you concessions. But when we ordered food, we still needed to tip! If you're charging more in the ticket price for the delivery of food, why is gratuity not included in the price? I'd rather get my own snacks. It was nice and clean but nothing special to be so pricey in tickets and food prices.

DmxCEfuQEWJ8mcnVOOq9jw.text: Fun, but pricey. Two tickets will cost you around $36. But on the plus side, the seats are assigned so at least you'll know exactly what you are paying for. Speaking of the seats, they are plush leather and they recline. They also have a tray table with a button so that you can order food and booze. The food I've had is pretty tasty, but as you can imagine it is also not cheap. Appetizers run from 6-14 dollars and entrees run from 12-22 dollars.   As odd as it sounds, the chicken strips with BBQ sauce are actually really good, and the fries are top notch. The pretzels and cheese dip are mediocre. All in all, it's a real fun date night but you need to go into it knowing you'll be spending around $60+ for tickets/food/drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Eclipse Theaters - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Reclined in our plush leather seats, enjoying the show.

flKFn1fh3rhp0S0Ta36lMw.text: I went solo to see Blade Runner 2049 the Thursday of release. I wanted to see if the theatrical experience here surpasses Galaxy Green Valley. Fantastic theater. Probably my favorite in the LV metro area, narrowly stealing the spot from Galaxy GV.   1. Parking: Dedicated parking in the small covered parking lot. (Mini parking structure?) Very easy to get into as long as you know it's there. Lots of street parking in case that's full.  2. Customer Service: Easy check-in. Was a little weird not having an email, confirmation number, or anything else to get my ticket but it worked. Bartender was nice, usher helpful, and wait staff were pleasant.   3. Seats: Seats were in great condition and comfy. Recline with wide armrests and a table just as you have in GGV. You have more vertical space between the rows, meaning people aren't blocking your vision if they're 7' tall.   4. Food/Drinks: Phenomenal. I had the Buffalo Chicken Flatbread. It was exactly what I was hoping for and money well spent. Plus using a call button to order was so painless. I wish their beer selection had something local on draft, but if I'm forced to drink a beer backed by AB Inbev I don't mind Space Dust since it is a solid IPA. Drink menu looks good, spirit/wine selection looked on point.  5. Screen: A teeny bit dark but I think it might have been Blade Runner 2049's cinematography and not the theater. Very sharp and clear picture though. Great screen to watch a movie on.   6. Sound: The weakest part of the experience for me was the sound. I think Dolby Atmos at the AMC Town Square or Galaxy's DFX Atmos at GGV or The Cannery are superior. But I think a small part of it was BR 2049's sound in general. It got a little loud and distorted like the speakers were hitting their limit. May have just been part of the movie though... This was the only 'meh' thing that I encountered.  7. Prices: $18 movie tickets are expensive but at least here or the GGV I can understand why. Eclipse, even moreso than GGV. At the time I bought this ticket, I had bought a ticket for BR 2049 in 3D DFX at GGV and refunded to try this theater out. Cost was $18 + a booking fee at Galaxy so costs are about the same for both theaters. $15 for the flatbread and $8 per beer. Not obscene and better quality than typical movie theater selection. You can pay that much for food cooked by actual cooking staff or $10 for a hotdog cooked on rollers at other theaters. Total out, pricing is pretty understandable for the experience.   Would I come back? Yes, for movies that I want this experience. Kind of a pain to drive the 15-20mins from Henderson. Prices would not stop me from coming here.  Would I recommend to people? 100% Yes. Especially to any of my friends that need a nice date spot or want to have the best time they can at the movies.

fmUmVJjcF9-2K23M9Wcd9w.text: What a great way to relax here in Vegas. Food was amazing, service was amazing and the seats super comfy.

ep4i0hKJcyDY-KmYfWHlWA.text: It'll be a miracle if Eclipse lasts another year.  This theatre is so out of the area's price range it is simply ridiculous. $18 matinees?  Not even Summerlin 5 is that much.   Plus my seat was broken here already.   More importantly, they put notes over the elevator discouraging people with disabilities from taking the elevator.  I was told it's been like this and there didn't appear to be immediate plans to fix.    #1 complaint - No art house films and it's right in the thick of the arts district.  At least one screen should only play Films such as "Beach Rats," "Brad's Status," "California Typewriter" and so much more. Unfortunately they just play the latest popcorn film over and over every hour.    #2 complaint - Expensive as Heck - Soda is poured in a small cocktail glass and you still pay movie theatre pricing.  Food is average for $13-18 entrees.  Draft Beer starts at $8.  Most are more.    #3 complaint - unfinished modern look only will go so far.  Signage is very poor.  Can't find most basic things without help.  It feels like a gym without the equipment.  The railings next to most seats are lit so much you can't have a dark theatre to watch their wide (sarcasm) selection of 2-4 films.    Only art house / indie films (and there are tons not played at Regal Village or Suncoast) added would make me come back.  And I'm their target audience.  I want them to succeed but this is sad how underutilized these theatres are used.   Even classic film days or nights would help make this place like an Alamo, the gold standard for this type of theatre. Please read this Eclipse / we need art and commerce.    In closing?  The Bottomless Mimosa campaign at early weekend shows.  You've got to be kidding.  I'm all for all day inebriation if you wanna but server comes from bar and has to bring every 15 minutes a new refill to the patron next to me.  Can we say interruptions galore?  Ahh, Eclipse I want you to succeed but it's exhausting.  You charge the most in the valley, service is great and film experience is at least up to par the average Regal experience.   I know you can do it.

BoULYThB0zpcFxES3x63IQ.text: Great wines and decent food options. Friendly staff and great bar area with music and lounge areas. Not very crowded on New Years Eve

The theater I was in was smaller, seated around 40 guests, really nice recliners and excellent service. Food was pricey but not as pricey as I had expected. Happy hour helped. 9eoPNGrpVoWtvK-OOQWv-A.text: Overall a great experience. There are not that many seats which is nice because it's comfortable and cozy. The service is great and the entire concept is exactly what Vegas needs. Only reason I gave 3 stars is because the chicken wings ordered were still cold/frozen, which was gross.

RCsnxOsgznSFAIK3kxyDtw.text: Overall, I like eclipse. It's nice. The food is great, the chairs are comfy and the staff is chill. My only suggestion would be doing something fun with the plain walls and hallways. It kind of has a garage feel to it.   I'll stick to downtown summerlin though.

2wIXK34_-yAFLgPAjfbPyw.text: Excellent theater and excellent service. Have been a regular since last October. Have gone to no other theater since finding Eclipse. Only negative comment, and it really isn't a negative comment, is regarding the food. New menu is good but got rid of some of the favorite items from previous menu. Last visit wanted to substitute fries for the onion rings and was told "no". Fries are cheaper than onion rings and they lost the sale over a fry and a onion ring. Instead of eating at theater went out to restaurant afterwards.  Should always allow for an equal substitution. Doesn't cost anything except when you don't and end up losing the sale.  All in all, will definitely be back again and again.

wuNPDyOpGhpU2kdYl4McHw.text: Love this place! Only place in Vegas we watch movies, I get a discount for being a veteran which I appreciate

OfkIq1NGb4SHwykpGUv1jg.text: Another small business I support! This is an upscale movie theatre, to say the least... it's like a fancy restaurant. Instead of being seated to a table, you're comfortable in recliner chairs, feet up and food & drinks are BROUGHT to YOU at your desire. They have a full bar, drink and food menu. But that's not what got me hype. It was the VEGAN OPTIONS that "wowed" me. Now I'm not sure if other movie theatres like AMC or other individually owned theatres offer vegan options (as I don't go to movie theatres often), but as far as I know, they don't. I'm glad they're about the movement! Hopefully they'll start offering juice/smoothie options *wink wink. Movie tickets are $18, but it's well worth it! I don't think I can go anywhere else to watch movies after coming here!

z1rQoUVo40Bv6F1gKLzOWA.text: Nice surprise as I am killing time while downtown.  Decided to catch a movie and found this place with Flixter.  Driving here and im thinking no movie theatre here.  Lo and behold i see it. Parked on street and walked in. Went to the machine and bought a chesp $12 ticket.   Walked up and into the salon.  Small thestre with recliner sofas.  Nice snack menu.    Same thing back home with ticket at $35. Great setup.  Popcorn brougjt to your seat was good too.

0qbVSSXnqiqJycYQ5MCV5w.text: I just saw the 6pm showing for Justice League (movie was amazing)! Theatre was a bit quiet for a Sunday night but the place is absolutely beautiful and cozy. Great for a date night or to just spoil yourself like I did. Upstairs has the bar, large lounge area and balcony to chill and socialize. Inside the theatre, seats were comfy and they have a button to push for service. Nice touch! The popcorn has REAL butter with sea salt on top was absolutely delicious and paired nicely with their organic cider beer YUMMY! Price for tickets and food are a bit steep...maybe offer something for locals or teachers lol...but I would definitely be back!

XGWfPyx7r75VWuLMH1QtTg.text: New favorite spot for movies. This takes luxury to a whole new level. I love the service & the fact that we can eat & drink at the touch of a button. However, the food isn't all that great! It's more about the experience. The perfect date night or girls night out especially with the location being downtown you can easily do something fun after a movie.

k2Bj-23llcgcAU9FUIvEPQ.text: What a high quality theater.  Great bar / lounge.  Great service.  The food was good and if just a little bit better, 5 stars to be had.  I will be back!

scq_wQotc5bETZfzky0SoA.text: Cool concept but pricey...I like how you are able to have someone come to you to take food/drink orders but I feel it's over priced. There are other cities that have the same concept but charge the same price as regular movie theaters. Also, it's freezing in this place! It feels like an icebox!
